item.title: Erin add a quote by Ann Voskamp
item.description: "In our rushing, bulls in china shops, we break our own lives." -- Ann Voskamp

item.title: Erin add a quote by Ann Voskamp
item.description: "I know the theological answers, but do my blood and my pulse?" -- Ann Voskamp

item.title: Erin add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "We were together. I forget the rest." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Erin add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I like the scientific spirit—the holding off, the being sure but not too sure, the willingness to surrender ideas when the evidence is against them: this is ultimately fine—it always keeps the way beyond open—always gives life, thought, affection, the whole man, a chance to try over again after a mistake—after a wrong guess." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Erin add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "And your very flesh shall be a great poem." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Erin add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "And as to me, I know nothing else but miracles" -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Erin add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "As a writing man, or secretary, I have always felt charged with the safekeeping of all unexpected items of worldly and unworldly enchantment, as though I might be held personally responsible if even a small one were to be lost." -- E.B. White

item.title: Erin add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "Anyone who writes down to children is simply wasting his time. You have to write up, not down. Children are demanding. They are the most attentive, curious, eager, observant, sensitive, quick, and generally congenial readers on earth.... Children are game for anything. I throw them hard words and they backhand them across the net." -- E.B. White

item.title: Erin add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "When you say something, make sure you have said it. The chances of your having said it are only fair. -E.B. White" -- E.B. White

item.title: Erin add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "Once in everyone's life there is apt to be a period when he is fully awake, instead of half-asleep." -- E.B. White

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "We must be careful with our lives, for Christ's sake, because it would seem that they are the only lives we are going to have in this puzzling and perilous world, and so they are very precious and what we do with them matters enormously." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "Coincidences are God's way of getting our attention." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "The original, shimmering self gets buried so deep that most of us end up hardly living out of it at all. Instead we live out all the other selves, which we are constantly putting on and taking off like coats and hats against the world’s weather" -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "The grace of God means something like: Here is your life. You might never have been, but you are because the party wouldn't have been complete without you." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "Without somehow destroying me in the process, how could God reveal himself in a way that would leave no room for doubt? If there were no room for doubt, there would be no room for me." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "Thus, when you wake up in the morning, called by God to be a self again, if you want to know who you are, watch your feet. Because where your feet take you, that is who you are." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "Here and there even in our world, and now and then, even in ourselves, we catch glimpeses of a New Creation, which, fleeting as those glipmses are apt to be, give us hope both for this life and for whatever life may await us later on." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "And now brothers, I will ask you a terrible question, and God knows I ask it also of myself. Is the truth beyond all truths, beyond the stars, just this: that to live without him is the real death, that to die with him the only life?" -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "Who can say when or how it will be that something easters up out of the dimness to remind us of a time before we were born and after we will die?" -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "What can you do to promote world peace? Go home and love your family." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "I'm a little pencil in the hand of a writing God, who is sending a love letter to the world." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "There are many people who can do big things, but there are very few people who will do the small things." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Do small things, with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "One of the greatest diseases is to be nobody to anybody" -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Erin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Imagine yourself as a living house. God comes in to rebuild that house. At first, perhaps, you can understand what He is doing. He is getting the drains right and stopping the leaks in the roof and so on; you knew that those jobs needed doing and so you are not surprised. But presently He starts knocking the house about in a way that hurts abominably and does not seem to make any sense. What on earth is He up to? The explanation is that He is building quite a different house from the one you thought of - throwing out a new wing here, putting on an extra floor there, running up towers, making courtyards. You thought you were being made into a decent little cottage: but He is building a palace. He intends to come and live in it Himself." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "There are far, far better things ahead than any we leave behind." -- C.S. Lewis
